data: Refer to buprenorphine long acting prescribing guidelines from BC Centre on Substance Use
Prescriber must have completed the buprenorphine long acting certification
Patients must be already stabilized on buprenorphine long acting injectable (SUBLOCADE) *OR* on sublingual buprenorphine-naloxone at a dose of at least 8 to 24 mg/day
The prescriber ordering buprenorphine long acting injectable must call the patient's community pharmacy to discontinue any ongoing provision of opioids in the community.
For delivery to Rapid Access Addiction Clinic (RAAC), order duration: 1 dose or times, drug form: syringe-ing, dispense qty: 1 syringe, refill(s): 0
For delivery to Rapid Access Addiction Clinic (RAAC), order duration: 1 dose or times, drug form: syringe-ing, dispense qty: 1 syringe, refill(s): 1
Monitor patient for 15 minutes after dose
Injection area 10-15 minutes prior to injection
